modules.name: QueryDsl
modules.comments: A type-safe and composable SQL query builder.

declarations.comments: Values that can be stored in database columns
declarations.title: Constant

declarations.comments: Types that can be converted to/from Constant values
declarations.title: SqlType

declarations.comments: A table definition, with a row-type parameter that captures the types of the columns in the table.
declarations.title: Table

declarations.comments: A column within a table, with the column type and optionality represented in the type of the Column
declarations.title: Column

declarations.comments: A query that selects data, with the type of the columns in the result represented in the type of the SelectQuery
declarations.title: SelectQuery

declarations.comments: A Monad for constructing a SQL from/join clause
declarations.title: SelectTableBuilder

declarations.comments: The select columns and the where clause part of a select query
declarations.title: SelectEndpoint

declarations.comments: A query that deletes data from a table
declarations.title: DeleteQuery

declarations.comments:
An expression that always evaluates to `true`. This is useful when a filtering
expression argument is required but you don't want to actually filter the result.
declarations.title: alwaysTrue

declarations.comments:
An instance of this type class is automatically derived by the compiler for
rows where each field in the row matches `name: Column typ required`, representing
a database table column called `name`, having a database type compatible with
the Purescript type `typ`, and being required or optional on insert according to `required`
declarations.title: TableColumns

declarations.comments: Makes a table with a given name, taking the column information from the declared type.
declarations.title: makeTable

declarations.comments: Starts a SelectTableBuilder by specifying the initial table.
declarations.title: from

declarations.comments: Extends a SelectTableBuilder by specifying a join table.
declarations.title: join

declarations.comments: Creates a new SelectEndpoint with the given selected columns
declarations.title: select

declarations.comments: Sets the where clause to use on the SelectEndpoint
declarations.title: where_

declarations.comments: Sets the limit (maximum number of rows in the result) to use on the SelectEndpoint.
declarations.title: limit

declarations.comments: Sets the offset (how many rows to skip from the result) to use on the SelectEndpoint.
declarations.title: offset

declarations.comments: An expression that determines how the results are ordered.
declarations.title: OrderingExpression

declarations.comments: Create an OrderingExpression that says to order by the given expression in ascending order
declarations.title: asc

declarations.comments: Create an OrderingExpression that says to order by the given expression in descending order
declarations.title: desc

declarations.comments: Sets the ordering to use on the SelectEndpoint
declarations.title: orderBy

declarations.comments:
Adds a column to the group by clause - note this function is cumulative:
call it multiple times to group by more than one expression.
declarations.title: groupBy

declarations.comments: Sets the having expression to use on the SelectEndpoint.
declarations.title: having

declarations.comments:
Instances of this type class are automatically derived by the compiler for
row types pairs where each field in `exprs` matches a column in `cols`
declarations.title: InsertExpressions

declarations.comments: Gets the columns associated with a table.
declarations.title: columns

modules.name: QueryDsl.Expressions
modules.comments:
Some operators for building where clauses and other expressions.

The operator precedence used here is designed to match the normal purescript operators.

declarations.comments: Run a query and ignore any results.
declarations.title: runQuery

declarations.comments: Run a `SelectQuery` and return all the results.
declarations.title: runSelectManyQuery

declarations.comments:
Run a `SelectQuery` and either return the single result, or throw an error
if there is more than one result or none at all.
declarations.title: runSelectOneQuery
